### Sniffing out TruffleHog in AWS


üìä **TECH INSIGHT**


The article titled "Sniffing out TruffleHog in AWS" discusses the use of the open-source tool TruffleHog to identify and mitigate the risks of exposing sensitive information within AWS environments. TruffleHog scans AWS accounts to detect any hardcoded secrets, such as API keys and passwords, which may have been inadvertently embedded in source code repositories. By highlighting the importance of securing these credentials, the article emphasizes best practices for managing secrets, including regular audits and employing AWS Secrets Manager for

**[Read the full article ‚Ä∫](https://redcanary.com/blog/threat-detection/trufflehog-aws/?utm_source=newsletter&utm_medium=email&utm_campaign=weekly_ai_cybersecurity&utm_content=article_7698)**

### Lawmakers Want to Ban VPNs‚ÄîAnd They Have No Idea What They're Doing


üìä **TECH INSIGHT**


In a recent push, some lawmakers have voiced intentions to ban virtual private networks (VPNs), displaying a fundamental misunderstanding of the technology and its critical importance in safeguarding digital privacy and security. VPNs are essential tools for protecting users' online activities, bypassing censorship, and securing data against cyber threats. The proposed ban, critics argue, could have significant negative implications for both individual users and businesses that rely on VPNs for secure communication and data protection. This initiative reflects a broader trend of policymakers struggling to

**[Read the full article ‚Ä∫](https://www.eff.org/deeplinks/2025/11/lawmakers-want-ban-vpns-and-they-have-no-idea-what-theyre-doing?utm_source=newsletter&utm_medium=email&utm_campaign=weekly_ai_cybersecurity&utm_content=article_4475)**

### Digital Doppelgangers: Anatomy of Evolving Impersonation Campaigns Distributing Gh0st RAT


üß† **AI ADVANCEMENT**


The article discusses the increasing sophistication of impersonation campaigns utilizing digital doppelgangers to distribute the Gh0st RAT malware. These campaigns involve attackers creating replicas of legitimate digital identities to deceive victims into downloading malicious software. The use of such tactics has enabled hackers to more effectively infiltrate systems by bypassing traditional security measures, as victims are more likely to trust what appears to be legitimate communication or software sources. The evolution of these impersonation strategies signals a need for enhanced security protocols and awareness to protect against

**[Read the full article ‚Ä∫](https://unit42.paloaltonetworks.com/impersonation-campaigns-deliver-gh0st-rat/?utm_source=newsletter&utm_medium=email&utm_campaign=weekly_ai_cybersecurity&utm_content=article_5271)**

### CAR-Flow: Condition-Aware Reparameterization Aligns Source and Target for Better Flow Matching


üìä **TECH INSIGHT**


The article titled "CAR-Flow: Condition-Aware Reparameterization Aligns Source and Target for Better Flow Matching" introduces a novel framework aimed at improving flow matching in various applications. CAR-Flow leverages Condition-Aware Reparameterization to align source and target distributions more effectively, enhancing computational efficiency and alignment accuracy. The framework addresses existing challenges in flow matching by dynamically adjusting parameters based on input conditions, leading to superior performance in tasks such as image synthesis and data translation. This innovative approach demonstrates significant

**[Read the full article ‚Ä∫](https://machinelearning.apple.com/research/car-flow?utm_source=newsletter&utm_medium=email&utm_campaign=weekly_ai_cybersecurity&utm_content=article_9820)**


---


### A Surveillance Mandate Disguised As Child Safety: Why the GUARD Act Won't Keep Us Safe


üìä **TECH INSIGHT**


The article critiques the proposed GUARD Act, arguing that it masquerades as a measure for enhancing child safety while primarily pushing for increased surveillance. The author suggests that the legislation could compromise personal privacy and civil liberties by expanding governmental powers to monitor digital communications. Despite its purported intent to protect children from online harm, the Act may not effectively address these issues and instead opens the door to potential misuse of surveillance capabilities. The article further contends that the bill could create more problems than it solves by failing to balance

**[Read the full article ‚Ä∫](https://www.eff.org/deeplinks/2025/11/surveillance-mandate-disguised-child-safety-why-guard-act-wont-keep-us-safe?utm_source=newsletter&utm_medium=email&utm_campaign=weekly_ai_cybersecurity&utm_content=article_7241)**
